title: Sio Moore
text:
Snorsio Alston "Sio" Moore (born May 2, 1990) is a <a href="Liberia">Liberia</a>n former professional <a href="American%20football">American football</a> <a href="linebacker">linebacker</a>. He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="Connecticut%20Huskies%20football">Connecticut</a>. Moore was drafted by the <a href="Oakland%20Raiders">Oakland Raiders</a> in the third round of the <a href="2013%20NFL%20Draft">2013 NFL Draft</a>. He also played for the <a href="Indianapolis%20Colts">Indianapolis Colts</a>, <a href="Kansas%20City%20Chiefs">Kansas City Chiefs</a>, <a href="Arizona%20Cardinals">Arizona Cardinals</a>, and <a href="Houston%20Texans">Houston Texans</a>.
Early years.
Moore was born in <a href="Liberia">Liberia</a> in <a href="West%20Africa">West Africa</a>, and moved to the <a href="West%20Haven%2C%20Connecticut">West Haven, Connecticut</a> when he was a child. He attended <a href="Apex%20High%20School">Apex High School</a> in <a href="Apex%2C%20North%20Carolina">Apex, North Carolina</a>, where he was a letterman in <a href="High%20school%20football">football</a> and <a href="track%20and%20field">track</a>. He played <a href="high%20school%20football">football</a> as a <a href="linebacker">linebacker</a>, <a href="running%20back">running back</a> and <a href="Fullback%20%28gridiron%20football%29">fullback</a>. He earned All-area and All-Tri Seven Football League honors as a fullback and linebacker as a senior.
Prior to signing with <a href="Connecticut%20Huskies%20football">Connecticut</a>, Moore made a visit to their summer camp in <a href="Storrs%2C%20Connecticut">Storrs, Connecticut</a>, where he was timed at 4.54 in the <a href="40-yard%20dash">40-yard dash</a>, 4.41 in the <a href="20-yard%20shuttle">short shuttle</a>, had a 38.5-inch (99 cm) <a href="vertical%20jump">vertical jump</a>, <a href="broad%20jump">broad jump</a>ed 10-foot-2 (3.13 m) and ran the <a href="100-meter%20dash">100-meter dash</a> in 11.1 seconds.
Regarded only as a two-star prospect grade by both "<a href="Rivals.com">Rivals.com</a>" and "<a href="Scout.com">Scout.com</a>", Moore was ranked No. 50 among the nation’s weak-side linebackers. He signed his national letter of intent to attend Connecticut on July 12, 2007.
College career.
While attending the <a href="University%20of%20Connecticut">University of Connecticut</a>, he played for the <a href="Connecticut%20Huskies%20football">Connecticut Huskies football</a> team from 2008 to 2012. During his college career, he totaled 274 tackles, 16 <a href="quarterback%20sack">quarterback sack</a>s and four <a href="interception">interception</a>s. Following his senior season in 2012, he was a first-team All-<a href="Big%20East%20Conference%20%281979%E2%80%932013%29">Big East Conference</a> selection and was invited to play in both the <a href="East-West%20Shrine%20Game">East-West Shrine Game</a> and the <a href="Senior%20Bowl">Senior Bowl</a>.
Professional career.
Oakland Raiders.
Moore was selected by the <a href="Oakland%20Raiders">Oakland Raiders</a> in the third round, with the 66th overall pick, of the <a href="2013%20NFL%20Draft">2013 NFL Draft</a>. On October 27, 2013, Moore picked up 2 sacks and 5 tackles in a 21-18 win against the <a href="Pittsburgh%20Steelers">Pittsburgh Steelers</a>.
Indianapolis Colts.
On September 4, 2015, Moore was traded to the <a href="Indianapolis%20Colts">Indianapolis Colts</a> for sixth round pick in the 2016 NFL draft. He was released by the Colts on October 4, 2016.
Kansas City Chiefs.
Moore was signed by the <a href="Kansas%20City%20Chiefs">Kansas City Chiefs</a> on October 7, 2016. On November 1, 2016, he was released by the Chiefs.
Arizona Cardinals.
On November 22, 2016, Moore was signed by the <a href="Arizona%20Cardinals">Arizona Cardinals</a>.
Houston Texans.
On June 3, 2017, Moore signed with the <a href="Houston%20Texans">Houston Texans</a>. On September 1, 2017, he was released by the Texans.
